module.name: Forms
module.short: Contains definitions and descriptions for constructing the Forms which are the basis of the Lazarus Graphical User Interface

element.name: TPosition
element.short: Represents the Position and Size on Screen of an Form

descr.p: poDesigned - The Form appears exactly as it is positioned and sized in the Form Designer
poDefault - The window manager decides how the form is to appear, in a default position and size
poDefaultPosOnly - keeps the Designed size, but position determined by windowmanager
poDefaultSizeOnly - keeps the Designed position, but size determined by windowmanager
poScreenCenter - Centers the form on screen
poDeskTopCenter - Centers the form on desktop
poMainFormCenter - Centers the Form on the Main Form
poOwnerFormCenter - Centers the Form on Owner form

element.name: TPosition.poDesigned
element.short: The Form appears exactly as it is positioned and sized in the Form Designer.

element.name: TPosition.poDefault
element.short: The window manager decides how the form is to appear, in a default position and size.

element.name: TPosition.poDefaultPosOnly
element.short: Keeps the designed size, but position determined by windowmanager.

element.name: TPosition.poDefaultSizeOnly
element.short: Keeps the designed position, but size determined by windowmanager.

element.name: TPosition.poScreenCenter
element.short: Centers the form on screen.

element.name: TPosition.poDesktopCenter
element.short: Centers the form on desktop (not recommended, use poScreenCenter).

element.name: TPosition.poMainFormCenter
element.short: Centers the Form on the Main Form.

element.name: TPosition.poOwnerFormCenter
element.short: Centers the Form on Owner form.

element.name: TWindowState
element.short: Represents the actual State of the window on the screen.

descr.p: The actual meaning of each value depends on the platform:
Windows and Mac OS X - These operating systems support all values.
X11 - The window state is a hint sent to the Window Manager, so more primitive Window Managers might ignore this hints.

Windows CE - In Windows CE platforms where Application.ApplicationType = atKeyPadDevice or atPDA (like in Windows Phone, PocketPC and Windows Mobile), wsMinimized and wsNormal are understood as wsMaximized, which is the normal state for windows in this platform. An exception are windows with BorderStyle=bsDialog or bsNone, which are allowed to have a custom position and size. For more information please read http://wiki.lazarus.freepascal.org/Windows_CE_Development_Notes#Positioning_and_size_of_Dialogs_and_Forms
Android - In this platform windows are always fullscreen.
The valid values for this enumerated type are:
wsNormal - The window appears normal
wsMinimized - The window is minimized and is not shown in the screen, but only in the taskbar
wsMaximized - The window appears maximized
wsFullScreen - The window appears in full screen mode, as much as allowed by the platform.

element.name: TCustomHintAction
element.short: TCustomHintAction - Base class for THintAction, the action for displaying a Hint

element.name: EScrollBar
element.short: Exception in Scroll Bar
element.descr: Exception class for Scroll Bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar
element.short: TControlScrollBar - base class for defining scroll bars on Forms and windows
element.descr: Control Scroll Bar: Scroll Bar control for adding to windows. Can be horizontal or vertical.

element.name: TControlScrollBar.FControl
element.short: FControl - local variable to hold the Window Control to which the scroll bar belongs

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ControlHandle
element.short: ControlHandle - the operating system handle for this control

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetSize
element.short: GetSize - returns the size of the scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.HandleAllocated
element.short: HandleAllocated - returns True if a handle has been allocated

element.name: TControlScrollBar.AutoCalcRange
element.short: AutoCalcRange - method for automatically calculating the range of values for the scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ControlUpdateScrollBars
element.short: ControlUpdateScrollBars - method to be used by the owner control for updating its scrollbars

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ScrollHandler
element.short: ScrollHandler - message handler to control scrolling

element.name: TControlScrollBar.SetSize
element.short: SetSize - specifies the size of the scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.UpdateScrollBar
element.short: UpdateScrollBar - method to update the scroll bar (position etc)

element.name: TControlScrollBar.InvalidateScrollInfo
element.short: InvalidateScrollInfo - method to render scroll information non-valid

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetHorzScrollBar
element.short: GetHorzScrollBar - find the position and properties of the horizontal scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetHorzScrollBar.Result
element.short: Returns details of the horizontal scroll bar as a pointer to a structure

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetVertScrollBar
element.short: GetVertScrollBar - find the position and properties of the vertical scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetVertScrollBar.Result
element.short: Returns details of the vertical scroll bar as a pointer to a structure

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Create.AControl
element.short: The identity of the windowed control in which the scroll bar is found

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Create.AKind
element.short: Whether this is a horizontal or a vertical scrollbar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Assign
element.short: If Source is a TControlScrollBar, copies properties to itself, else performs inherited Assign.
element.descr: Assigns the contents of the source object to the current object; in particular finds the increment, position, range and whether smooth scrolling is to be feature and whether the scroll bar is visible

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Assign.Source
element.short: The object that called this instance of the class

element.name: TControlScrollBar.IsScrollBarVisible
element.short: Returns current widget state.

element.name: TControlScrollBar.IsScrollBarVisible.Result
element.short: True if scroll bar visible.

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ScrollPos
element.short: Position of the indicator cursor on the scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ScrollPos.Result
element.short: Returns position of the scroll cursor as an integer

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Kind
element.short: Finds which kind of scroll bar this is: horizontal or vertical
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine which kind of scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetOtherScrollBar
element.short: Finds out details of the other scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetOtherScrollBar.Result
element.short: Returns a link to the details of the other scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Increment
element.short: The size of the scrolling increment
element.descr:
The amount by which the scroll indicator moves if the triangle at either end of the bar is selected.
Read or write a flag to determine the increment, an integer with a default value of 8 (pixels)

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Page
element.short: The size of the paging increment for scrolling
element.descr:
The amount by which the scroll indicator moves if the cursor selects the scroll bar above, below or on either side of the scroll indicator.
Reads or writes a flag to determine paging increment; default value is 80 pixels

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Position
element.short: Position of the scroll bar
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag with the position; default is zero

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Smooth
element.short: Determine whether smooth scrolling is to be implemented
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag to determine smooth scrolling, and sets a flag is the scrolling status is stored

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Range
element.short: The range (extent) of the scroll bar
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag to determine the range; default is zero

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Size
element.short: Determine the size of the scroll bar
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag to determine the size; by default the size is not stored

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Visible
element.short: Can the scroll bar be made visible?
element.descr: Reads or writes flag to determine visibility, and sets a flag if the property is stored. The Handle object (widget) is made visible if (Visible=true) and (Range>Page). To get the current visible state of the widget use the method IsScrollBarVisible.

element.name: TScrollingWinControl
element.short: Class of a Window Control that has one or more scroll bars.

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.AlignControls
element.short: AlignControls - calls inherited AlignControls, then calculates sizes for the scrollbars if required

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.CreateWnd
element.short: CreateWnd - performs inherited CreateWnd then updates ScrollBars

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.GetClientScrollOffset
element.short: GetClientScrollOffset - finds the position for scrollbars from the client, if any, otherwise sets default postiions

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.GetLogicalClientRect
element.short: GetLogicalClientRect - adjusts client rect to allow for size of scrollbars

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.DoOnResize
element.short: DoOnResize - performs inherited DoOnResize then updates scrollbars if needed

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.WMHScroll
element.short: WMHScroll - system message method for horizontal scrolling

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.WMVScroll
element.short: WMVScroll - system message method for vertical scroling

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.ComputeScrollbars
element.short: ComputeScrollbars - returns True if scroll bar positions need to be computed

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.ScrollbarHandler
element.short: ScrollbarHandler - method for handling scroll bars of specified kind at specified position

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.Loaded
element.short: Loaded - calls inherited Loaded and updates scroll bars

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.UpdateScrollbars
element.short: Update the position of the scroll indicatores in the scroll bars

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.GetControlClassDefaultSize
element.short: GetControlClassDefaultSize inserts its own defaults, overriding inherited values

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.ScrollBy
element.short: ScrollBy - amount by which to scroll

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.AutoScroll
element.short: Does auto-scrolling apply?
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag to determine auto-scrolling

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.HorzScrollBar
element.short: The properties of the horizontal scroll bar

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.VertScrollBar
element.short: The properties of the vertical scroll bar

element.name: TScrollBox
element.short: A box with scroll bars.

element.name: TCustomFrame
element.short: TCustomFrame - the base type for TFrame

element.name: TCustomFrame.GetChildren
element.short: GetChildren - calls inherited GetChildren then accepts ownership of all owned components that have no parent

element.name: TCustomFrame.Notification
element.short: Notification calls inherited Notification then add or removes the component's action list (depending on what Operation specifies)

element.name: TCustomFrame.SetParent
element.short: SetParent - calls inherited Setparent after validity checks, then updates the action lists

element.name: TCustomFrame.DefineProperties
element.short: DefineProperties- calculates low and high values for frame design from ancestor class

element.name: TCustomFrame.GetControlClassDefaultSize
element.short: GetControlClassDefaultSize - returns its own defaults for frame design, overriding the inherited values

element.name: TFrame
element.short: TFrame - a container for all the other components on a form, or for a group of components within a form

element.name: TIDesigner
element.short: TIDesigner - a class describing a Form Designer

element.name: TBorderIcon
element.short: TBorderIcon - enumerated type to specify which icon appears on the top border of the Form
element.descr:
biSystemMenu - The form has a System menu (Maybe not all windowmanager supports this)
biMinimize - The form has an minimize button
biMaximize - The form has a maximize button
biHelp - When you click this button a Question Cursor appears and the help routines are called if you click on an control

element.name: TBorderIcons
element.short: TBorderIcons - set of TBorderIcon; the group of icons to appear at the top of the form

element.name: THelpEvent
element.short: Type of an application OnHelp handler.

element.name: TDropFilesEvent
element.short: Type of an application OnDropFiles handler[?]

element.name: TFormStateType
element.short: TFormStateType - enumerated type to describe the state of a form; whether it is being created or destroyed, its visibility, whether Modal etc

descr.p: The valid states are:
descr.pre: fsCreating, // initializing (form streaming) fsVisible, // form should be shown fsShowing, fsModal, // form is modal fsCreatedMDIChild, fsBorderStyleChanged, fsFormStyleChanged, fsFirstShow, // form is shown for the first time fsDisableAutoSize

element.name: TFormState
element.short: TFormState - the set of form states that apply to this form

element.name: TModalResult
element.short: TModalResult - the range of values that can be returned as a modal result
element.descr: TModalResult represents the value returned by a modal dialog. Even though the type is defined as an integer, instead a few standard constants are used as return results in applications.

element.name: TCustomForm
element.short: The base type for TForm.

element.name: TCustomForm.FActionLists
element.short: FActionLists - local variable holding lists of actions asociated with the Form

element.name: TCustomForm.CMShowingChanged
element.short: CMShowingChanged - system message method for showing if the form has changed

element.name: TCustomForm.DoShowWindow
element.short: DoShowWindow automatically choose a control to focus

element.name: TCustomForm.Activate
element.short: Activate - method for rendering the Form active

element.name: TCustomForm.ActiveChanged
element.short: ActiveChanged - method for a form that is active and changed

element.name: TCustomForm.AdjustClientRect
element.short: AdjustClientRect - adjusts window size to accommodate borders

element.name: TCustomForm.BeginFormUpdate
element.short: BeginFormUpdate - start updating the Form

element.name: TCustomForm.CreateParams
element.short: CreateParams calls inherited CreateParams, and specifically copies style from parent

element.name: TCustomForm.CreateWnd
element.short: CreateWnd calls inherited CreateWnd, signals if a handle is required and attaches a menu to the window if one does not yet exist; activates focus if visible

element.name: TCustomForm.Deactivate
element.short: Deactivate - method for rendering the Form inactive

element.name: TCustomForm.DoClose
element.short: DoClose - close the Form using the specified CloseAction

element.name: TCustomForm.DoCreate
element.short: DoCreate - perform the Create action

element.name: TCustomForm.DoDestroy
element.short: DoDestroy- perform the Destroy action

element.name: TCustomForm.DoHide
element.short: DoHide - method for hiding a previously visible object

element.name: TCustomForm.DoShow
element.short: DoShow - method to redender visible a previously hidden form

element.name: TCustomForm.EndFormUpdate
element.short: EndFormUpdate - finish updating the Form

element.name: TCustomForm.GetChildren
element.short: GetChildren calls inherited GetChildren then takes ownership of all components, including those without parents

element.name: TCustomForm.Loaded
element.short: Loaded - calls inherited Loaded, makes this the active control and gives it focus

element.name: TCustomForm.ChildHandlesCreated
element.short: ChildHandlesCreated - method for use when handles have been created for descendants

element.name: TCustomForm.Notification
element.short: Notification calls inherited Notification then add or removes the component's action list (depending on what Operation specifies)

element.name: TCustomForm.SetZOrder
element.short: SetZOrder - set the Z order for the Form; if Topmost is True, Form is on top of all other objects

element.name: TCustomForm.UpdateShowing
element.short: UpdateShowing - method to update the Visible property

element.name: TCustomForm.DoFirstShow
element.short: DoFirstShow - perform the first Show action since creation of the Form

element.name: TCustomForm.UpdateWindowState
element.short: UpdateWindowState - update the state of the Window displaying the Form

element.name: TCustomForm.VisibleChanging
element.short: VisibleChanging - method for dealing with a Form whose Visible property is changing

element.name: TCustomForm.WndProc
element.short: WndProc - performs actions specific to the message then calls inherited WndProc

descr.p: WndProc - performs actions specific to the message then calls inherited WndProc
Specific messages include:
Activate, SetFocus. KillFocus; Exit, Enter; Window Position Changing; Draw Item

element.name: TCustomForm.GetDefaultDockCaption
element.short: GetDefaultDockCaption - returns the default caption to be used for docking

element.name: TCustomForm.CMActionExecute
element.short: CMActionExecute - system message method for executing action

element.name: TCustomForm.CMActionUpdate
element.short: CMActionUpdate - system message method for updating action

element.name: TCustomForm.DoExecuteAction
element.short: Asks every visible control to Execute the specified action ExeAction.

descr.p: DoExecuteAction asks every visible control to Execute the specified action ExeAction. If some control executes it and returns true, then the traversal of visible components is stopped. All child controls (and its children etc) are queried too.
For example you have
then the following controls are queried in this order: TPanel, TButton, TCheckBox, TMemo.
But first of all, the Form itself and the ActiveControl are asked to execute the given action.

element.name: TCustomForm.DoExecuteAction.Result
element.short: True, if any control handles the action.

element.name: TCustomForm.DoExecuteAction.ExeAction
element.short: Action to execute.

element.name: TCustomForm.DoUpdateAction
element.short: DoUpdateAction - asks all visible controls to update the specified action

element.name: TCustomForm.UpdateActions
element.short: UpdateActions - method for updating actions

element.name: TCustomForm.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomForm: checks for correct ClassType, looks for required resources then creates the Form
element.descr: This constructor can override the constructor of an ancestor class

element.name: TCustomForm.CreateNew
element.short: CreateNew - constructor for creating a completely new form

element.name: TCustomForm.BeforeDestruction
element.short: BeforeDestruction - method to be applied before Form is destroyed (usually involves clean-up)

element.name: TCustomForm.BigIconHandle
element.short: BigIconHandle - returns system Handle for large Icon

element.name: TCustomForm.CloseQuery
element.short: Is the associated query to be closed?

element.name: TCustomForm.DefocusControl
element.short: DefocusControl - withdraws focus from the specified control, removing it if required

element.name: TCustomForm.EnsureVisible
element.short: Ensure that this form is always visible, if necessary moving it to the top (front) of the stack of images

element.name: TCustomForm.FocusControl
element.short: FocusControl - giving focus to specified control, automatically bringing form to front
element.errors: If the control or one of its parents is not visible or disabled an exception will be raised.

element.name: TCustomForm.GetFormImage
element.short: GetFormImage - gets a Bitmap image for the Form

element.name: TCustomForm.GetRolesForControl
element.short: GetRolesForControl - returns a set of roles (default, cancel) for the Form

element.name: TCustomForm.IntfDropFiles
element.short: IntfDropFiles - Invokes OnDropFilesEvent of the form. This function is called by the interface.

element.name: TCustomForm.IntfHelp
element.short: IntfHelp - Show help for control or menu item. This function is called by the interface.

element.name: TCustomForm.IsShortcut
element.short: IsShortcut - if True, the specified Key and Message are active as a shortcut

element.name: TCustomForm.Release
element.short: Set free the resources of the form

element.name: TCustomForm.CanFocus
element.short: True when the form can receive the focus.
element.descr: A control can receive the focus when it is visible and enabled, and all its Parents also can receive the focus.

element.name: TCustomForm.SetFocusedControl
element.short: SetFocusedControl - method for giving focus to specified control; returns True if successful

element.name: TCustomForm.SetRestoredBounds
element.short: SetRestoredBounds - set the bounds defining the position of the restored control

element.name: TCustomForm.ShowModal
element.short: Show this form as modal - ie control cannot be resumed by another form until the current form is closed

element.name: TCustomForm.ShowOnTop
element.short: Shows this form as the top (nearest) item of any stack of windows or images.

element.name: TCustomForm.SmallIconHandle
element.short: SmallIconHandle - returns system Handle for small Icon

element.name: TCustomForm.WantChildKey
element.short: WantChildKey - returns True if the specified child control requires a key (Message)

element.name: TCustomForm.AddHandlerFirstShow
element.short: AddHandlerFirstShow - perform the action for adding a handler at the time of first showing

element.name: TCustomForm.RemoveHandlerFirstShow
element.short: RemoveHandlerFirstShow - perform the action for removing the handler on the first showing

element.name: TCustomForm.AddHandlerClose
element.short: AddHandlerClose - adds a handler for closing Form

element.name: TCustomForm.RemoveHandlerClose
element.short: RemoveHandlerClose - removes handler for closing form

element.name: TCustomForm.AddHandlerCreate
element.short: AddHandlerCreate - performs the OnCreateHandler event

element.name: TCustomForm.RemoveHandlerCreate
element.short: RemoveHandlerCreate - removes the handler for the Create event

element.name: TCustomForm.Active
element.short: Is true when the form has the focus
element.descr: Use active to check if the form has the focus

element.name: TCustomForm.ActiveControl
element.short: Specifies the active control on the form
element.descr: Use this to get or set the active control on this form

element.name: TCustomForm.ActiveDefaultControl
element.short: Specifies the active default control on the Form

element.name: TCustomForm.AllowDropFiles
element.short: Specifies if files are allowed to be dropped on this form.
element.descr: Set AllowDropFiles event to True to allow dropping files on this form. It is set to False by default.

element.name: TCustomForm.BorderIcons
element.short: Specifies which icons appear on the top of the form
element.descr:
Use bordericons flags to get or set the icons that appear on the top border of the form.
By default we see down-triangle or other generic icon on the left,
which activates a pop-up system menu allowing closure or re-sizing of the form,
and on the right end we see the minimise and re-size/maximise buttons,
but of course these can be customised by the application programmer.

element.name: TCustomForm.BorderStyle
element.short: The border style for this Form

descr.p: Use borderstyle to get or set the appearance of the form's border.
By default it is a sizeable window, but it could, for example, be a dialog form or a tool window, or could be non-sizeable

This property is slightly different (has a differert base type) from the TCustomControl.BorderStyle When the form is put into another control the window borders depend on the widgetset. There are no borders under gtk.

element.name: TCustomForm.CancelControl
element.short: The control associated with the cancel action

descr.p: Determines the control associated with the Cancel action (exit from the control without changing anything).
This is usually a button with the caption 'Cancel', but might be an 'Exit' button or anything else the application programmer decides.
This control is selected either by explicitly clicking with the mouse, or by hitting the 'Esc' key

element.name: TCustomForm.Color
element.descr: The form's colour; by default it is the same as the colour specified for button faces.

element.name: TCustomForm.DefaultControl
element.short: The control associated with the default action for this form
element.descr:
Reads or sets a flag determining the default control.
This is typically a button such as 'Accept' which is highlighted in some way on-screen to indicate that this is the default action, and is selected either by hitting 'Return' or 'Enter' or by selecting that control with the mouse

element.name: TCustomForm.FormState
element.short: Determines the state of the form
element.descr:
Reads or writes a flag to determine the form's state:
is it being created, is this its first showing, is the border style being changed, etc.
FormState is a set, so could take zero or more of possible values.

element.name: TCustomForm.FormStyle
element.short: Determinates the style of the form

descr.p: Reads or writes flag to determine the style of the form.
Default is 'normal', but could be MDIChild or MDINormal, could stay on top or could be a 'Splash' form.
FormStyle is a set, so could take zero or more of these values.

element.name: TCustomForm.HelpFile
element.short: Specifies the help file that is used by the form
element.descr:
Reads or writes a flag to determine identity of Help file,
and to determine whether its name is stored.
Property contains filename as a string.

element.name: TCustomForm.Icon
element.short: The Icon associated with this Form (which may appear in menus, directories, ListBoxes etc)

element.name: TCustomForm.KeyPreview
element.short: KeyPreview - if True, Key Preview is possible

element.name: TCustomForm.Menu
element.short: Specifies a MainMenu for this form
element.descr: Drop a TMainMenu on the form and select it here to show it on the form.

element.name: TCustomForm.ModalResult
element.short: Specifies the return value of an modal form
element.descr:
Reads or writes a flag to determine whether there is a modal resut.
If the form is modal, returns an integer value.

element.name: TCustomForm.Monitor
element.short: Monitor - returns the monitor on which the form is mostly places (the biggest form area is placed)

element.name: TCustomForm.OnActivate
element.short: Event called when the form receives focus
element.descr: This method is called when the form receives focus for the first time at application start up and then subsequently each time focus is changed from another window of the same application to this window. For focus changes between different applications the event Application.OnActivate is called instead.

element.name: TCustomForm.OnClose
element.short: Event handler for closing the form

element.name: TCustomForm.OnCloseQuery
element.short: Event handler for closing the query associated with the form

element.name: TCustomForm.OnCreate
element.short: Event handler for creating the form

element.name: TCustomForm.OnDeactivate
element.short: Event handler for deactivating the form

element.name: TCustomForm.OnDestroy
element.short: Event handler when the form is being destroyed

element.name: TCustomForm.OnDropFiles
element.short: The event invoked when file is dropped on this form.
element.descr: The OnDropFiles event is invoked when user drops one or multiple files on this form. You enable this feature by setting AllowDropFiles property.

element.name: TCustomForm.OnHelp
element.short: Event handler when Help is required

element.name: TCustomForm.OnHide
element.short: Event handler if form is being hidden

element.name: TCustomForm.OnShortcut
element.short: Event handler if shortcut key is pressed

element.name: TCustomForm.OnShow
element.short: Event handler if form is to be shown

element.name: TCustomForm.OnWindowStateChange
element.short: Event handler for a change in the window state

element.name: TCustomForm.PixelsPerInch
element.short: The scaling of the form in absolute terms

descr.p: Reads or writes a flag to determine the scaling factor (a longinteger).
Not normally stored locally

element.name: TCustomForm.Position
element.short: The position of the form on the screen
element.descr:
Reads or writes a flag to determine screen position of form.
By default it is in the position that it was placed in the Form Designer

element.name: TCustomForm.RestoredHeight
element.short: The height of the form when it is restored (ie changes from minimised or maximised)

element.name: TCustomForm.RestoredLeft
element.short: The position of the left edge of the form when it is restored (ie changes from minimised or maximised)

element.name: TCustomForm.RestoredTop
element.short: The position of the top edge of the form when it is restored (ie changes from minimised or maximised)

element.name: TCustomForm.RestoredWidth
element.short: The width of the form when it is restored (ie changes from minimised or maximised)

element.name: TCustomForm.ShowInTaskBar
element.short: Should the form be shown in the system Task Bar?

element.name: TCustomForm.Visible
element.descr: Set or get this to set the form visible/hidden or get the status of the form

element.name: TCustomForm.WindowState
element.short: Represents how the form appears on the screen
element.descr:
Reads or write flag to determine state of the window on screen.
Default is 'normal' (ie not minimised or maximised)

element.name: TCustomFormClass
element.short: TCustomFormClass - class of TCustomForm

element.name: TForm.ClientHandle
element.short: The operating system handle for the client

element.name: TForm.LCLVersion
element.short: The version of the LCL as string. Used to distinguish form streams of different versions.

element.name: TFormClass
element.short: TFormClass - class of TForm

element.name: TCustomDockForm
element.short: TCustomDockForm - Base class for docking forms

element.name: TCustomDockForm.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomDockForm: performs CreateNew then initialises autoscroll and style properties

element.name: THintWindow
element.short: Hint Window - the popup box containing helpful information that appears when the mouse pointer hovers over an object

element.name: THintWindow.ActivateHint
element.short: Allow the hint message to be displayed in the specified rectangular space

element.name: THintWindow.ActivateHintData
element.short: Allow the hint message to be displayed, with a pointer to further data

element.name: THintWindow.CalcHintRect
element.short: Work out the size of the rectangle required to display the specified hint message

element.name: THintWindow.ReleaseHandle
element.short: Release the handle for the hint message and return it to the system

element.name: THintWindow.AutoHide
element.short: Does the hint disappear (get hidden) after a while?
element.descr: If AutoHide is TRUE, the hint disappears afer an interval specified by HideInterval

element.name: THintWindow.HideInterval

descr.p: Two queues are used:
New calls are added to the Next queue.
When the application starts processing the calls, the Next queue becomes the Cur queue, and a new Next queue is created. This simplifies thread-safe addition of further calls.

element.name: TApplication.CreateForm
element.short: Creates a Form or component, owned by Application.

descr.p: Note: The name is confusing and only kept for Delphi compatibility. It can actually create any kind of component.
Creates a Component instance of the given class, sets the pointer to the component variable [and loads the component?].
[If it is a form it will be added to the application's forms list.?]
A splash form is shown immediately.

element.name: TApplication.CreateForm.Reference

element.errors: Exceptions on various inconsistencies of the queue.

element.name: TApplication.QueueAsyncCall.Data
element.short: The argument passed to the method.

element.name: TApplication.RemoveAsyncCalls
element.short: Removes all calls added via QueueAsyncCall.
element.descr: This is thread safe.
element.errors: Exceptions on various inconsistencies of the queue.

element.name: TApplication.ReleaseComponent
element.short: Safe destruction of a component, can be requested by the component itself.
element.descr: Unless the application is shutting down, all requests are queued. Queued requests are processed when the application is not currently processing a message.

element.name: TApplication.ReleaseComponent.AComponent

element.name: TApplication.UpdateAction

element.name: TApplication.HandleException
element.short: HandleException method for handling an exception; attempts to maintain program execution if possible, otherwise exits gracefully
element.descr:
Individual exception handler methods should be supplied by the application programmer, to override place-holder entries declared in ancestor classes.
This method checks whether the application is required to halt if an exception occurs, or invokes the appropriate handler.
It also writes details of the exception to the appropriate place for debugging.

element.name: TApplication.HandleMessage
element.short: Handles all messages, then enters Idle state.

element.name: TApplication.HelpKeyword

element.name: TApplication.ShowHelpForObject.Sender

module.element:
Called when the the mouse is over a control with a Hint[?]
Does nothing [exists for Delphi compatibility only?]

element.name: TApplication.Initialize
element.short: Initializes the widgetset (and more).

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox
element.short: Display an message dialog with several response buttons.

descr.p: The function is used internally to display messages during the handling of Exceptions, but is also available to application programmers as an alternative to some of the message dialogs found in Dialogs.
The function returns an integer value corresponding to the button that was pressed; its value can be determined by reference to the constants [IDOK..IDHELP].

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox.Result
element.short: Indicates the pressed button.
element.descr:
Can be one of the following values:
IDOK
IDCANCEL
IDABORT
IDRETRY
IDIGNORE
IDYES
IDNO
IDCLOSE
IDHELP

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox.Text
element.short: The text in the MessageBox.

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox.Caption
element.short: The Caption of the MessageBox.

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox.Flags
element.short: The icon and buttons appearing in the box.

descr.p: Several constants are declared in the LCLType unit.

Add (better: OR) an icon constant and a buttons constant, for example
MB_ABORTRETRYIGNORE + MR_ICONQUESTION will cause the application to display a query (?) icon in a box with three buttons:
ABORT RETRY IGNORE.
Buttons can be one of:

MB_OK
MB_OKCANCEL
MB_ABORTRETRYIGNORE
MB_YESNOCANCEL
MB_YESNO
MB_RETRYCANCEL
The icon can be one of:

MB_ICONHAND
MB_ICONQUESTION
MB_ICONEXCLAMATION
MB_ICONASTERISK
MB_ICONWARNING = MB_ICONEXCLAMATION
MB_ICONERROR = MB_ICONHAND
MB_ICONSTOP = MB_ICONHAND
MB_ICONINFORMATION = MB_ICONASTERISK

element.name: TApplication.Hint
element.short: The current Hint text.

descr.p: A hint is a small pop-up mesage that appears briefly while the mouse hovers over a control.
It usually displays useful information about how to use an object or what data should be entered, etc
Several properties allow to customize the delay before a Hint is shown, after an mouse move, and how long it will stay visible.

element.name: TApplication.HintColor
element.short: The color of Hint windows.

element.name: TApplication.HintHidePause
element.short: How long a Hint stays visible, after an mouse move.

element.name: TApplication.HintHidePausePerChar
element.short: How much a keystroke extends the time a Hint stays visible (added to HintHidePause).

element.name: TApplication.HintPause
element.short: The delay before a Hint is shown.

element.name: TApplication.HintShortCuts
element.short: Enables the display of keyboard shortcuts (e.g. on menu entries). [not implemented?]

element.name: TApplication.HintShortPause
element.short: The pause before a different Hint is displayed.

element.descr: Tracks modal forms showing another form modally.

element.descr: Used to detect mouse entering and leaving a control.

element.name: TApplication.Navigation
element.short: Allows to switch between controls by pressing keys.

descr.p: These keys can be enabled for navigation:

ul.li: The Tab key moves the Focus to the next (or previous) control in TabOrder.
The Enter key triggers the default action.
The Escape key triggers the Cancel action.
The F1 key brings up context sensitive help.
The Arrow keys move the focus.[?]

element.name: TApplicationProperties
element.short: TApplicationProperties: The properties of the current application

descr.p: TApplication Properties can be set as a local default set of properties to be used for any new instance fo TApplication

element.name: TApplicationProperties.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TApplicationProperties: calls inherited Create, then sets some defaults if new application is being designed, or loads local values from existing application

element.name: TApplicationProperties.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TApplicationProperties: removes a number of handlers then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TApplicationProperties.CaptureExceptions
element.short: CaptureExceptions - Determine whether exceptions are being captured
element.descr: Boolean property (true if exceptions are being captured); reads or writes flag to see if they are being captured

element.name: TApplicationProperties.HelpFile
element.short: HelpFile - Determines which file to use for Help
element.descr: Reads or writes flag to determine name of Help file - name is stored as a string

element.name: TApplicationProperties.Hint
element.short: Hint - Determines Hint to be used
element.descr: Reads or writes flag to determine Hint - stored as a string

element.name: TApplicationProperties.HintColor
element.short: HintColor - Colour to be used when displaying Hint
element.descr: Reads or writes flag to determine Hint colour (stored as a TColor integer)

element.name: TApplicationProperties.HintHidePause
element.short: HintHidePause - the length of pause before a hint becomes hidden

element.name: TApplicationProperties.HintPause
element.short: HintPause - the length of pause before a hint is displayed

element.name: TApplicationProperties.HintShortCuts
element.short: HintShortCuts - the hints for shortcut keys (present if True)

element.name: TApplicationProperties.HintShortPause
element.short: HintShortPause - the length of pause before a shortcut hint is displayed

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnDropFiles
element.short: OnDropFiles - Event handler when files are dropped on the form

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnEndSession
element.short: OnEndSession - Event handler for the end of the session

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnException
element.short: OnException - Event handler for exceptions

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnHelp
element.short: OnHelp - Event handler when help is needed

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnHint
element.short: OnHint - Event handler when a hint is needed

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnIdle
element.short: OnIdle - event handler for the Idle state

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnIdleEnd
element.short: OnIdleEnd - event handler for the end of the Idle state

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnMinimize
element.short: OnMinimize - Event handler for minimising the form

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnQueryEndSession
element.short: OnQueryEndSession - Event handler for a query at the end of a session

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnRestore
element.short: OnRestore - Event handler for restoring a form which has been minimised or maximised

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnShowHint
element.short: OnShowHint - Event handler for showing a hint

element.name: TApplicationProperties.OnUserInput
element.short: OnUserInput - Event handler when user input is received

element.name: TApplicationProperties.ShowButtonGlyphs
element.short: ShowButtonGlyphs - determines whether to show show or not glyphs on TBitBtn controls
element.descr:
This option allows to set rule for all application TBitBtn controls which have GlyphShowMode = gsmApplication.
Different operation systems has different preferences regards showing button glyphs. Mac OS X and Windows UI guidlines suggests not to use them. Gnome has a special theme setting for this. sbgSystem option allows application to use system preferences for glyphs showing. sbgAlways is the default value because of Delphi compatibility.

element.name: TApplicationProperties.ShowHint
element.short: ShowHint - Determines whether a hint is to be displayed
element.descr: Read or write flag to determine whether to display hint (stored as boolean, True if hint is to be displayed)

element.name: TApplicationProperties.ShowMainForm
element.short: ShowMainForm - Determines whether main form is to be displayed

element.name: TApplicationProperties.ShowMenuGlyphs
element.short: ShowMenuGlyphs - Deturmines whether show or not glyphs in menu
element.descr:
This option allows to set rule for all application TMenuItem components which have GlyphShowMode = gsmApplication.
Different operation systems has different preferences regards showing images in menus. Mac OS X suggests not to use them. Gnome has a special theme setting for this. sbgSystem option allows application to use system preferences for menu icons showing. sbgAlways is the default value because of Delphi compatibility.

element.name: TApplicationProperties.Title
element.short: Title to be shown in Application's top Border

element.name: TMessageBoxFunction
element.short: TMessageBoxFunction - the function to be used by a message box: specifies Text and Flags, and returns an integer value

element.name: TDefaultMonitor
element.short: The preferred monitor for showing a form.

descr.p: When a form is not assigned to a specific monitor, assume the following display context:

ul.li: dmMainForm - on the same monitor as the main form. If there is no main form then use dmPrimary behavior.
dmActiveForm - on the same monitor as the currently active form. If there is no active form use dmMainForm behavior.

element.name: TDefaultMonitor.dmDesktop
element.short: Place the form on the full desktop.

element.name: TDefaultMonitor.dmPrimary
element.short: Place the form on the primary monitor.

element.name: TDefaultMonitor.dmMainForm
element.short: Place the form on the same monitor as the main form. If there is no such form then use the primary monitor.

element.name: TDefaultMonitor.dmActiveForm
element.short: Place the form on the same monitor as the currently active form. If there is no such form then use the primary monitor.
